com.indra.iquality.model

Class Flow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.indra.iquality.model.Flow

  • public class Flow
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class Pase. Represents an ETL flow for a system and software version. A flow can't (shouldn't) get any of its fields modified after it's been executed as an Execution.
    Version:
    0.5, 10-dic-2015 The Class Pase.
    Author:
    Ignacio N. Lucero Ascencio

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> dependencias

      private java.lang.String esAtipico
      Indicates if the flow is typical or atypical.
      private int id
      The unique immutable identifier.
      private java.lang.String[] jobs
      The identifiers of the jobs that will run on this flow.
      private java.lang.String nombre
      The descriptive name of the flow.
      private java.lang.String sistema
      The system on which the flow will be executed.
      private java.lang.String software
      The software version of the system.

    • Field Detail

      • id

        private int id
        The unique immutable identifier.

      • nombre

        private java.lang.String nombre
        The descriptive name of the flow.

      • esAtipico

        private java.lang.String esAtipico
        Indicates if the flow is typical or atypical. Can me either 'S' or 'N', corresponding to typical and atypical.

      • sistema

        private java.lang.String sistema
        The system on which the flow will be executed.

      • software

        private java.lang.String software
        The software version of the system.

      • jobs

        private java.lang.String[] jobs
        The identifiers of the jobs that will run on this flow. See Job

      • dependencias

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> dependencias
        The dependencies among the jobs of this flow. The key is the identifier of a job j, the values are the identifiers of the jobs that must finish successfully before j can be executed. See Dependency

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flow

        public Flow()
        Instantiates a new empty flow.

      • Flow

        public Flow(java.lang.String nombre,
            java.lang.String esAtipico,
            java.lang.String[] jobs,
            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> dependencias)
        Instantiates a new flow with a given name, typicality, list of jobs and list of dependencies. System and software will be set to those active in the current environment. See Environment .
        Parameters:
        nombre - the name of the flow
        esAtipico - the typicality
        jobs - the list of jobs
        dependencias - the dependencies of the jobs

      • setDependencias

        public void setDependencias(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> dependencias)
        Sets the dependencies of the jobs associated to this flow.
        Parameters:
        dependencias - a map whose key is the identifier of a job and the value is an array with the identifiers of the jobs on which that depends
